author: @thecooldown.com
title: New method of generating solar power could have a lasting impact: 'Agrivoltaic solar arrays will win the rural solar war'
text: With energy production, [pollinator](https://www.thecooldown.com/green-home/how-to-make-your-yard-a-friendlier-place-for-pollinators/) protection, and crop growth promotion, [agrivoltaics](https://cleantechnica.com/2024/06/08/agrivoltaic-solar-arrays-will-win-the-rural-solar-war-with-insects/), an innovative approach to [solar power](https://www.thecooldown.com/solar-panels/), has the potential to provide a reasonable answer to growing rural backlash against solar power, support insect populations, and maximize benefits for both agriculture and [alternative energy](https://www.thecooldown.com/green-tech/clean-energy-get-money-back-on-bill-solar-wind-power/) industries, per recent reporting in [CleanTechnica](https://cleantechnica.com/2024/06/08/agrivoltaic-solar-arrays-will-win-the-rural-solar-war-with-insects/). Burning coal, oil, and gas [for power](https://www.clarity.io/blog/a-deep-dive-economic-impacts-of-air-pollution) releases [toxic pollution](https://www.thecooldown.com/green-tech/short-term-air-pollution-cancer-cardiovascular-disease-study/) into our atmosphere that can cause serious problems for our [health](https://www.thecooldown.com/green-tech/air-pollution-effects-on-digestive-system-liver-pancreas/), [finances](https://www.clarity.io/blog/a-deep-dive-economic-impacts-of-air-pollution), extreme [weather](https://www.thecooldown.com/outdoors/how-air-pollution-amplifies-heatwave-extremes/), and more. [Solar power](https://www.thecooldown.com/solar-panels/) is a less expensive energy source that turns sunlight into energy without the accompanying [harmful pollution](https://energy.sc.gov/). As the [South Carolina Energy Office](https://energy.sc.gov/) wrote [on its website](https://solar.sc.gov/learn-about-solar/how-solar-works), "[Solar] energy is free, immune to rising energy prices, and can be used to provide heat, lighting, mechanical power, and electricity." But responses aren't always so bright. Successful Farming [reported](https://www.agriculture.com/solar-and-wind-farms-generate-controversy-but-occupy-a-sliver-of-rural-land-8654435) significant setbacks to solar initiatives in rural regions ‚Äî including adverse reactions from area residents and intense local government restrictions. The revolutionary technique of agrivoltaics, engineered to keep underlying farmland available for use, could change all that. Instead of placing [solar panels](https://www.thecooldown.com/solar-panels/) on [rooftops](https://cleantechnica.com/?s=tina+casey+agrivoltaic), agrivoltaics are strategically situated [on fields](https://cleantechnica.com/?s=tina+casey+agrivoltaic) to create [partial shade](https://cleantechnica.com/2024/06/08/agrivoltaic-solar-arrays-will-win-the-rural-solar-war-with-insects/), retain [soil water](https://cropwatch.unl.edu/2024/soil-water-plant-interaction-basics), and increase crop production. This method means the same land can be used for farming and clean energy generation. Per [CleanTechnica](https://cleantechnica.com/2024/06/08/agrivoltaic-solar-arrays-will-win-the-rural-solar-war-with-insects/): "Agrivoltaic solar arrays will win the rural solar war." Combining the U.S. Department of Agriculture's [Conservation Reserve Program](https://www.fsa.usda.gov/programs-and-services/conservation-programs/conservation-reserve-program/index) with incentives to pursue agrivoltaics would enable farmers to make money, preserve farmland, [protect flora and fauna](https://www.thecooldown.com/green-home/how-to-make-your-yard-a-friendlier-place-for-pollinators/), and prevent pollution, the CleanTechnica report noted. "Evidence is also accumulating in support of the beneficial impacts on [pollinator](https://www.thecooldown.com/green-home/how-to-make-your-yard-a-friendlier-place-for-pollinators/) habitats and native flora," stated CleanTechnica ‚Äî a high-value proposition considering [worrisome reductions](https://entomology.ucr.edu/news/2023/07/13/researchers-study-global-decline-insect-populations) in the global insect population. Those big wins have agrivoltaics gaining buzz. In June, the [New York State Energy Research and Development Authority](https://www.nyserda.ny.gov/) announced a $5 million program supporting agrivoltaic solar development, as reported by CleanTechnica. "This initiative seeks to strike a balance between achieving renewable energy targets and supporting the agricultural sector," said [New York Ag Connection](https://newyorkagconnection.com/news/new-york-launches-5m-agrivoltaic-program-for-clean-energy), and sets a precedent for other states to potentially follow. Excited about this new frontier? Let that fuel your [exploration](https://guide.thecooldown.com/actions/explore-critical-climate-issues/) into the world of alternative [and more affordable](https://www.thecooldown.com/green-home/hvac-hack-save-money-energy-bill/) energy. Calculate how much you'd save [with solar powe](https://www.thecooldown.com/green-home/solar-panels-value-home-how-much/)r and [install your own panels at home](https://guide.thecooldown.com/actions/install-solar-panels/), learn about [community solar](https://guide.thecooldown.com/actions/sign-up-for-community-solar/) programs, level up [daily life](https://guide.thecooldown.com/journeys/modernize-your-home/) with [cool technology](https://guide.thecooldown.com/actions/upgrade-to-a-natural-lawn/), and preserve [pollinators](https://guide.thecooldown.com/actions/upgrade-to-a-natural-lawn/) in [your own yard](https://guide.thecooldown.com/journeys/upgrade-your-yard/). Whatever you choose, there are sunny skies ahead. Join our [free newsletter](https://www.thecooldown.com/future-newsletter/?recY50xMT3Soi9XS2) for cool news and actionable info that makes it easy to help yourself while helping the planet.

author: Zachary Neel
title: Oregon Basketball: Ducks overcome 18-point deficit to beat California
text:
The weather was cold outside, with freezing rain falling from the sky all day in Eugene. There were warnings coming from the county, encouraging people to stay home and off of the roads unless it was necessary to go out.
It appeared that the Oregon Ducks‚Äô offense was heading that call early in this game, largely threatening to keep them out of this game in the first half thanks to poor shooting, and a lack of ball movement. However, they turned things around with a 16-2 run right before the half and found a way to pick up an impressive win at home over the California Golden Bears.
It marked Oregon‚Äôs 13th win of the season, and kept them a perfect 5-0 in conference play.
Here‚Äôs everything you need to know about the game:
Final Score: Oregon 80, California 73
The Ducks overcame an 18-point first-half deficit to eventually down the California Golden Bears 80-73 at home, winning their sixth-straight game.
Keys to the Game
It was a cold start to the game for Oregon as far as offense goes, with a 1-for-5 start from deep. The Ducks weren‚Äôt playing terribly on defense, but they lacked aggressiveness on the offensive side of the ball, settling for a lot of mid-range and deep shots that weren‚Äôt falling. While the Ducks struggled to get their shots, Cal couldn‚Äôt miss. A 7-0 run midway through the first half allowed the Golden Bears to ultimately build an 18-point lead, where they were shooting over 60% from the floor and 57% from deep. Oregon woke up late in the half, and went on a 16-2 run to close out the half and make it a 4-point Cal lead, which felt much closer than it should have been. Coming out of the half, both teams traded buckets for a while, with the Ducks ultimately taking the lead on a three-pointer from Jackson Shelstad. As the second half went on, Oregon built a small lead and held it for quite a while. They were up 73-67 by the final media timeout. Surprisingly, Cal chose not to play the foul game, allowing Oregon‚Äôs offense to hold strong in the final minutes as they went on to win the game, 80-73. Players of the Game
Jermaine Couisnard: 18 points, 3 rebounds, 1 assists Bam Tracey: 14 points, 4 rebounds Jackson Shelstad: 12 points, 6 rebounds Keeshawn Barthelemy: 12 points, 5 assists Key Stats to Know
Jackson Shelstad tied Tyler Dorsey for the most consecutive games scoring 10 points or more as a freshman since 2000. Shelstad finished the game with 12 points. After starting the game hitting just 1 of their first 5 three-pointers, Oregon settled in a little bit, hitting 9 of their next 23 from beyond the arc. N‚ÄôFaly Dante made his return to the floor for the first time since the season opener, playing 17 minutes. He looked solid, putting up 8 points and 2 rebounds. The Ducks got a ton of production from their bench in this game, scoring 39 bench points on the night. Play of the Night ON. HIS. HEAD. üî•
Kario finishes with authority! #GoDucks
üì∫ @Pac12Network pic.twitter.com/P4iC5j3NUJ
‚Äî Oregon Men's Basketball (@OregonMBB) January 14, 2024
What's Next?
The Ducks set off for the infamous mountain road trip this week, playing against the Colorado Buffaloes on Thursday night, and then turning around and playing the Utah Utes on Saturday evening. Both the Buffs and Utes have been among the more impressive teams in the conference thus far, though injuries have been a factor as of late.

author: Canadian Press
title: Records for warmest December set or tied in Vancouver and other parts of B.C.
text:
VANCOUVER ‚Äî Data from Environment Canada has confirmed what winter sport enthusiasts have known for a while ‚Äî December was warm in British Columbia.
Five communities in the province set or equalled temperature records for the month while the warm weather, combined with a lack of rain or snow, has done little to ease ongoing drought concerns.
Meteorologist Brian Proctor said the mean temperature at Vancouver International Airport last month was 7 C, tying with 1939 as the city's warmest December on record since data started being collected in 1896.
The mean temperature was 3.4 degrees higher than what is considered normal for the month.
Proctor said Tuesday that warm weather records for December were also either set or tied in Victoria, Comox, Campbell River and Abbotsford.
The month was also very dry, meaning there wasn't enough rain or snow to ease drought concerns in the province, he said.
In the northeastern municipality of Chetwynd, for example, less than a millimetre of precipitation was recorded in December. The community usually sees about 19 millimetres.
"In general terms, it hasn't been enough to alleviate the long-standing drought," Proctor said.
"It's helped to sort of pull it back a little bit, but what we really do need, more than anything else, is we need snowpack. And we're not getting snowpack out of these kinds of systems at this point in time."
The province's final drought update of the year, posted at the end of November, lists eight of B.C.'s 34 basins at the two highest levels of risk for adverse drought impacts.
The northeast corner of B.C., which includes the Fort Nelson and Peace regions, remains at the highest level of drought where adverse impacts are almost certain.
Proctor says the first full week of January is expected to get cooler with some snow possible at higher elevations
This report by The Canadian Press was first published Jan. 2, 2024.
The Canadian Press
Note to readers: This is a corrected story. A previous version said December wasn't warm enough to break records in British Columbia. In fact, Environment Canada now says multiple communities either broke or tied heat records.

author: Jessica Moriarty - BBC News, West of England and Beth Cruse - BBC News, West of England
title: Severe weather plan activated as snow forecast
text:
Severe weather plan activated as snow forecast Jessica Moriarty - BBC News, West of England and Beth Cruse - BBC News, West of England Fri, January 3, 2025 at 7:20 AM UTC 1 min read
SWEP is activated when temperatures fall below zero [PA Media] Emergency measures have been put in place across a county to protect rough sleepers from the cold.
Wiltshire Council is the latest local authority in the west to activate its Severe Weather Emergency Provision (SWEP) as snow and ice is forecast.
The measures aim to ensure that anyone sleeping on the streets is offered a room when temperatures dip below zero.
It comes after the UK Health Security Agency (UKHSA) issued an amber cold health alert for all regions in England.
Advertisement Advertisement Advertisement The agency has warned that the cold snap is "likely to result in increased use of health care services by vulnerable people".
Wiltshire Council has requested rough sleepers are referred to them via Streetlink or by calling 0300 456 0106, the Local Democracy Reporting Service said.
The council will contact all known rough sleepers with information about overnight accommodation, and direct them to services.
SWEP is backed by the government, and Wiltshire Council works with the UKHSA and Met Office when considering whether the temperature threshold has been met.
The measures have also been activated in Swindon, Gloucestershire and Bristol after the Met Office issued an updated yellow snow and ice warning for large parts of the UK this weekend.
Advertisement Advertisement Advertisement Follow BBC Wiltshire on Facebook , X and Instagram . Send your story ideas to us on email or via WhatsApp on 0800 313 4630 .

author: DiePressecom
title: Neuer Schnelltest erkennt Viren, Bakterien und Pilzsporen
text:
Leobener Forschende haben ein umfassend einsetzbares Diagnosewerkzeug entwickelt. Neben Anwendungen im Gesundheitsbereich k√∂nnte es sich auch zur Umwelt√ºberwachung nutzen lassen.
Leobener Forschende haben ein umfassend einsetzbares Diagnosewerkzeug entwickelt. Neben Anwendungen im Gesundheitsbereich k√∂nnte es sich auch zur Umwelt√ºberwachung nutzen lassen.
F√ºr den Schnelltest bl√§st man in ein R√∂hrchen, das mit diesem Filter ausgestattet wurde. Dabei landen winzige Tr√∂pfchen der ausgeatmeten Luft, die bei einer Infektion Viren, Bakterien oder Sporen enth√§lt, auf der Oberfl√§che des Filters. Diese k√∂nnen durch die optische Methode ‚ÄûSurface Enhanced Raman Spectroscopy‚Äú nachgewiesen werden. Hierzu bringt ein Laser die Proteinstrukturen in den Tr√∂pfchen zum Schwingen: der sogenannte Raman-Effekt.
Der Nachweis alleine reicht aber nicht aus, um eine genaue Diagnose zu stellen. ‚ÄûEs ist eine Herausforderung, die spezifischen Fingerabdr√ºcke von Viren, Bakterien und anderen Mikroorganismen zu identifizieren, vor allem, wenn in den Atemtr√∂pfchen eine Vielzahl unterschiedlicher Strukturen drinnen ist‚Äú, schildert Kostoglou die Komplexit√§t der Aufgabenstellung.

author: fashionnetwork.com
title: Puma asciende a Andreas Hubert como director de operaciones - FashionNetwork M√©xico
text:
Un trimestre despu√©s de asumir el cargo de consejero delegado de Puma , Arthur Hoeld ha incorporado a un nuevo miembro a su comit√© de direcci√≥n. El fabricante alem√°n de equipamiento deportivo ha anunciado el ascenso de Andreas Hubert a director de operaciones, lo que le convierte en el quinto miembro del comit√©.
Andreas Hubert - Puma
Como director de operaciones, este veterano con 20 a√±os de experiencia en la empresa, que asumir√° su nuevo cargo el 1 de septiembre, ser√° responsable de las operaciones de abastecimiento global, incluyendo la sostenibilidad y el desarrollo de productos, las TI y la log√≠stica.
Aunque durante los √∫ltimos cuatro a√±os ha sido director de informaci√≥n, supervisando la estrategia tecnol√≥gica, los sistemas, las aplicaciones y los servicios inform√°ticos de la empresa, es un especialista en aprovisionamiento, habiendo sido anteriormente vicepresidente de Aprovisionamiento para Puma , con sede en Hong Kong. Anne-Laure Descours, directora de abastecimiento del grupo durante hace muchos a√±os, dej√≥ Puma en la primavera, aunque sigue prestando asesor√≠a en el desarrollo de soluciones m√°s responsables desde el punto de vista social y medioambiental.
Publicidad Andreas Hubert asumir√° funciones que antes eran responsabilidad de otros departamentos. El aprovisionamiento era responsabilidad del director de producto; la inform√°tica, del director financiero; y la log√≠stica, del director general, seg√∫n ha explicado el grupo. "Estoy encantado de dar la bienvenida a Andreas a Puma como nuestro nuevo director de operaciones", declar√≥ Arthur Hoeld, consejero delegado de Puma. "Con su amplia experiencia en TI, abastecimiento y gesti√≥n de la cadena de suministro, aporta la combinaci√≥n perfecta de visi√≥n estrat√©gica y excelencia operativa. Su profunda experiencia en el sector y sus conocimientos ser√°n fundamentales para optimizar las operaciones globales de Puma, impulsar la transformaci√≥n digital y fortalecer la resiliencia de nuestra cadena de suministro a medida que entramos en nuestra pr√≥xima fase de crecimiento."
El grupo ha rebajado recientemente sus previsiones anuales . A partir del 1 de septiembre de 2025, el comit√© ejecutivo de Puma estar√° formado por Arthur Hoeld (consejero delegado), Markus Neubrand (director financiero), Maria Valdes (directora de producto), Matthias B√§umer (director comercial) y Andreas Hubert (director de operaciones).
Este art√≠culo es una traducci√≥n autom√°tica. Haga clic aqu√≠ para leer el art√≠culo original.

author: Staff Writer
title: Maximize Your Visuals: Top Reasons to Consider Upgrading Your Graphics Card
text:
Are you a passionate gamer or a creative professional looking to enhance your visual experience? If so, it might be time to consider upgrading your graphics card. A graphics card is an essential component of any computer system that plays a crucial role in delivering stunning visuals and smooth performance. In this article, we will explore the top reasons why upgrading your graphics card can significantly enhance your overall computing experience.
Enhanced Gaming Performance
For avid gamers, nothing beats the feeling of immersing oneself in a virtual world filled with stunning visuals and lifelike details. However, outdated graphics cards can often struggle to keep up with the demands of modern games, leading to choppy frame rates and laggy gameplay. By upgrading your graphics card, you can unlock the full potential of your gaming experience.
A newer graphics card with advanced features and higher memory capacity allows for smoother gameplay, faster rendering times, and improved frame rates. Whether you‚Äôre exploring vast open-world environments or engaging in fast-paced multiplayer battles, an upgraded graphics card ensures that you never miss a moment of action.
Crisp and Vibrant Visuals
Beyond gaming, upgrading your graphics card can also greatly benefit creative professionals who work with graphic-intensive applications such as video editing software or 3D modeling programs. These applications require significant processing power to render complex visuals accurately.
With an upgraded graphics card, you can expect improved color accuracy, better shading effects, and smoother rendering times. This means that every detail in your artwork or project will come to life with greater clarity and vibrancy. From editing high-resolution videos to creating intricate 3D models, an upgraded graphics card ensures that your work looks its best.
Future-Proofing Your System
Technology advances at a rapid pace, especially in the world of computer hardware. What may be considered cutting-edge today could become outdated within a few years. By upgrading your graphics card, you are future-proofing your system and ensuring that it can handle the demands of tomorrow‚Äôs software and games.
Newer graphics cards often come with the latest features, improved performance, and better compatibility with upcoming technologies. Upgrading now means you won‚Äôt have to worry about compatibility issues or being left behind as new software and games are released.
Increased Productivity
Graphics-intensive tasks go beyond gaming and creative work. Many modern applications, including web browsers and streaming services, rely on hardware acceleration to deliver a smooth user experience. An upgraded graphics card can significantly improve the performance of these applications, resulting in faster load times, smoother video playback, and overall increased productivity.
Additionally, if you use your computer for tasks such as data visualization or complex simulations, a more powerful graphics card can greatly reduce processing times. This means that you can complete tasks more efficiently and spend less time waiting for results.
In conclusion, upgrading your graphics card is a worthwhile investment for gamers and creative professionals alike. The benefits of enhanced gaming performance, crisp visuals, future-proofing your system, and increased productivity make it an essential upgrade for those seeking to maximize their visual experience. So why wait? Take your computing experience to new heights by upgrading your graphics card today.
This text was generated using a large language model, and select text has been reviewed and moderated for purposes such as readability.

author: Abigail O'Leary
title: Brutal storm could cause mass shipping delays week before Christmas as states brace for snow and rain - The Mirror US
text:
The U.S. East Coast began a whiplash-inducing stretch of weather this week with a deluge of rain, rapid snowmelt and powerful gusts, creating dangerous conditions and the [potential for holiday chaos.](https://www.themirror.com/incoming/brutal-storm-could-cause-mass-856738)
As a powerful storm system stretches from Florida to Maine, Utilities braced for widespread power outages with winds projected to exceed 60 mph (97 kph). [AccuWeather ](https://www.accuweather.com/en/weather-forecasts/shipping-delays-possible-as-storms-unleash-snow-rain-before-the-holidays/1722259)meteorologists say [several storms](https://www.themirror.com/entertainment/celebrity-news/christmas-winter-storm-polar-vortex-854240) will now continue to spread rain and snow across parts of the country before Christmas, which could complicate shopping and shipping for people purchasing last-minute gifts.
Forecasters are warning shoppers ahead of Christmas, Hanukkah and Kwanzaa could be hampered by the storms, with delivery times possibly affected due to shipping delays.
READ MORE: [Christmas snow alert as Polar Vortex poised to dump 11 feet in days before big holiday](https://www.themirror.com/entertainment/celebrity-news/christmas-winter-storm-polar-vortex-854240)
READ MORE: [World's longest underwater 'mega tunnel' to cost $46 billion but will halve 21-hour drive](https://www.themirror.com/news/world-news/worlds-longest-underwater-mega-tunnel-853099)
A key driver in the weather was [an atmospheric river](https://apnews.com/us-news/california-floods-natural-disasters-general-news-f197ceb5d69bb795f7a220effc364a6a), which is a long band of water vapor that can transport moisture from the tropics to more northern areas, said Derek Schroeter, a forecaster with the National Weather Service. New England was bearing the brunt as the storm [tapped moisture](https://apnews.com/article/atmospheric-rivers-explainer-pineapple-express-pacific-california-8ab9a1f5bcda656055f11b71ed5b31c0) from the Atlantic Ocean off the coast of the U.S. Southeast, and transported it to places like Maine, he said.
Alex Hobbs, a Boston college student, hopes that the weather won‚Äôt interfere with her plans to return home to San Francisco soon.
‚ÄúI‚Äôm a little worried about getting delays with heavy wind and rain, possibly snow,‚Äù she said Wednesday.
In New England, the storm began with combination of fog and freezing rain Tuesday night into early Wednesday, making travel treacherous. A tractor-trailer carrying a load of oranges went off the Maine Turnpike in New Gloucester; the road was so treacherous that the oranges couldn‚Äôt be removed until a day later.
In New Hampshire, the Mount Washington Avalanche Center issued a special bulletin Wednesday for the Presidential Range of mountains, which received significant snowfall over the last two weeks. ‚ÄúHeavy rainfall could create dangerous and unpredictable avalanche conditions on steep snow-covered slopes,‚Äù the avalanche center warned.
Atop Mount Washington, wind gusts hit 89 mph (143 kph). The location is one of the planet‚Äôs windiest spots. Its highest gust recorded for 2023 was 132 mph (212 kph). From January to December of that year, it saw 145 days with gusts of 73 mph (117 kph) or higher.
Sign up to our FREE newsletter and get the top stories to your inbox
DAILY NEWSLETTER: [Sign up here](https://www.themirror.com/newsletter-preference-centre/?view=Solus&mailingListId=ab05ec34-5eed-44b8-861e-5fa7078535c3&utm_source=solusarticle) to get the latest news and updates from the Mirror US straight to your inbox with our FREE newsletter.
